column4: I had ff 3.5.0 stable version. Enthused by its stability, I ventured to install 3.6.2pre.. I did this after I included lines deb-src and deb http://ppa.launchpad.net/ubuntu-mozilla-daily/ppa/ubuntu  - main in my ubuntu hardy repo. Later, I discovered that I could neither cope up with bugs nor be useful in making tests since already 3.6.0 stable version is out. Now I want to revert to the...
...stable ver. 3.6.0 or 3.7.0. I tried uninstalling/reinstalling without efffect. I am installing only 3.6.2! HELP!
you need to uninstall first, then remove that line from your sources, and then find a place for a stable 3.6 or alternatively stick to the old firefox you were using.
I tried that. I also tried forcing version 3.6.0  - no use. I get back that 3.6.2 thing again and again on installing!
you removed the daily ppa from the sources, and cleared your package cache?
How to clear package cache?
sudo aptitude clean
it's not adviceable or easily possible yet
to any other version than the forthcoming 10.04, when it's released
so you suggest that from 8.04 to 10.04 is better than switching thru 9.xx?
it's certainly faster and less error prone
it's just not possible until 10.04 is officially released
the system probes what hardware it's on and probably won't complain at all. but you should try the live cd perhaps first
I've not even heard 3.7.0 has been officially published yet
and it's not, judging from mozilla.org
my synapt. manages shows it.!
that doesn't mean it's officially released
if you've got only ubuntu repositories on your system, then you shouldn't even have anything above 3.5.2 visible
then which is the stable ver to go with Hardy? I want to make sure before installing! now I have removed ff fully and cleaned my cache.
thanks and ubottu is becoming clever. Wherefrom it got the cue?
any console you want
